title: Jennifer Garner explains to Katie Couric why her teen daughter is too young for Instagram
text:
CLOSE The actress, activist and mom of three is doing her part to change the world. Time

Jennifer Garner may have been "13 going on 30," but she says her 13-year-old won't be going on Instagram any time soon.

The 47-year-old actress discussed the phenomenon of parents posting pics of their kids on social media and why she doesn't allow her teen daughter Violet on Instagram, in an interview on "Next Question with Katie Couric" published Thursday.

Though Garner, who shares three children with her ex-husband Ben Affleck, conceded social media "makes you feel more connected," she worries about the toll these sites can take on kids' mental health.

"Without even having parents who are well-known, I worry about all kids having to deal with this new pressure," she said

Garner added she's seen the power social media plays in her daughter's world.

More: Jennifer Garner criticizes 'People' magazine over cover story

"My daughter's at an all-girl school, and it's such a huge problem, and she'll occasionally talk to me about getting Instagram, and I can see why, because I'm on there (Instagram)," she continued. "It's something kind of fun that I do, and I am modeling the opposite of what I want for her to do. How often is that in parenting?"

Jennifer Garner poses with her children Violet, left, Seraphina and Samuel in Hollywood last year. (Photo: Robyn Beck, AFP/Getty Images)

If Garner's daughter hopes to get an Instagram account one day, the actress says she'll need science on her side.

"And I just say, 'When you can show me studies that say that teenage girls are happier using Instagram than not, then we can have the conversation,' " she said. "But everything you look at, I don't see anything positive for you out there."

In the meantime, Garner said her daughter can live vicariously through mom's account.

More: Jennifer Garner recalls being 'surrounded by paparazzi' while married to Ben Affleck

"You can look at mine when you want to, we can go over it together, but I just don't see it," she said.

Garner also described to Couric her choice to not post photos she takes of her kids on social media as well as her family's frustrating bouts with paparazzi.

More: Jennifer Garner describes being 'hounded 24/7 for 10 solid years' by photographers

"It kills me, because of course I want to share them," she said. "I'm so proud of them, and I think they're really funny and cute. The real thing is that there is no judgment in what other people do. It is such a personal choice."

She added: "We really were hunted for so long, and I am not a whiny 'wah wah' person who put myself out in public and then said, 'Why are you taking pictures of me?' But it was so out of control, and it really marked my children's experience out in the world, and it shaped who they became in certain ways."

In addition to Violet, Garner and Affleck share Seraphina, 10, and Samuel, 7.
